hints.content:
All of the triangles show $\dfrac23$ shaded.  

However, for two fractions to be equivalent, they must refer to the same size whole.
Which answer choice shows $\dfrac23$ of the same size wholes shaded?

This pair of triangles shows equivalent areas shaded:



[[☃ image 1]]

$=$

[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: Two triangles that are the same size. There is an equal sign between the two triangles. The top triangle is divided into 3 equal parts. Two parts are shaded blue. The bottom triangle is divided into 3 equal parts. Two parts are shaded. !

Two triangles that are the same size. There is an equal sign between the two triangles. The top triangle is divided into 3 equal parts. Two parts are shaded blue. The bottom triangle is divided into 3 equal parts. Two parts are shaded. !

question.content:
**Which pair of triangles have equivalent areas shaded?**


[[☃ radio 1]]
